page.title: 08INDUSTRY IN ROGERSTONE-1
page.content: There has been heavy industry in the area since 1772 when copper rolling mills were built along the River Ebbw at Rogerstone Castle. The site was taken over by a steelworks and since 1936 by an aluminium rolling works. This company is the largest employer (1,100 jobs) in the area attracted to the region by Newport Docks, railway access, labour and water supplies. They make household and industrial foil and many components. Rogerstone power station was built in 1957, supplied by nearby coalmines + River Ebbw cooling water, but has recently proved inefficient and was closed in 1984. The region offers 2942 manufacturing jobs and 860 service jobs: the latter include schools, pubs, garages, and shops.
